instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2849: What is 820-2849? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bad GPU?
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sign of liquid damage. Powers cycles on and off for about a 1/2 second, during that time fan spins and all rails appear to be present. 

Not much experience working on this board, I'm starting to think GPU is toast.

Any thoughts?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Bad GPU?
threads.message:
How did this happen?
<CHIP>U2850</CHIP> pin 4 pulses too?
Also check pins 2/4 of <CHIP>U7980</CHIP>.
Check voltage for all Power FETs at page 73.
3V42 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stable?
Does it stay on in SMC bypass mode?
